TITLE: Client Meeting 1 - RAQ system
ACTIONS: Ask Allan if we could see the older original system
Determine which browsers this should run on
Alain will come back in two weeks for follow up on this
DECISIONS: Recognition of aquired competencies
Instead of taking course, you can evaluate knowledge and allow them to not take the course
For people who worked in a similar industry
File Analysis - Resume, Contract, etc
It's a preliminary assessment. See if RAC is a good fit for the student
They had to do a self assessment where they situate themselves based on the course competencies
Each course has different competencies attached to it. They evaluate themselves against these competencies
Once they've completed evaluating their competencies, they need to submit their resume/contracts prooving that they've done these competencies in the field
They then check what the possible method of recognition are - RAQ, Course, EQ/SU - This is filled out by Alain
They need to have a content specialist who will determine on a provisional basis what the best suited course of action would be.
They just check it out to make sure the course of action makes sense
The candidate at the beginning of this is not enrolled in the college
If they want to pursue this then they apply for the college - which is an entirely different system
They're presented with a formal progression profile
Going for a DEC, they need a content specialist for all the Gen-Eds, English, French, Philosophy, and their program specific competencies
For cont-ed / AEC programs, there will be no gen-eds
When submitting files, they also hand over the courses that they've taken at other colleges or university
You can be accredited through work experience or through previous courses taken
If the knowledge is outdated, then the content specialist will review that and will recommend accordingly
SU - Substitution / EQ - Equivalency / RAC - Recognition of Acquired Competencies
Ideally, the applicant would get a form for each Gen-Eds and program specific course and fill out a form with what all they think they have for competencies
If the student does not meet one of the competencies, they can get training tailored to the competency
For UI - There needs to be an appeal to the user completing this form - Very welcoming look and feel to it.
They need to go through the beginning of this whole process without talking to anybody - Then Alain will reach out to them, they don't need to initiate
Allow the candidate to miss information like documents - Gives Alain more reason to reach out to them
Goes to Alain, Alain determines who the specialist is, Specialist returns recommendations to Alain, Alain returns the decision to 'student'
The content specialist can be anybody Alain knows is an expert in that field, a teacher at this school, a teacher at another one, someone in Montreal, etc.
Name, Phone, Email, College student number (if applicable), if they're a previous Heritage student, if they're a Quebec resident (Address information)
No need for high-level authentication in the early stages. However, when they produce the formal progression profile, there needs to be electronic signatures, but not too much.
Competencies pulled from Clara
No dealing with validating documents submitted - other than doc size or type maybe so they don't submit a 45gb zip
This is purely to assess their suitability for RAQ, everything else is out of the scope of this project - We just build the system flow.
This is to establish a relationship with the candidate at a technical level
Everything needs to be accessible from outside the school network
The system needs to be fully mobile responsive - Doesn't matter for Alain because he's only doing this at work
Alain can delete candidates, candidates can make and update their profiles
Timeline between self assessment to Alain's response - Can be a few weeks before getting back to the candidate
By the time they get everything through, it can be a month
They submit all their forms before the interview.
A kind of partial completion of the profile and once they've submitted everything, then Alain gets to see it all.
Doesn't need to entirely match the college look and feel, but it should be recognizable as Heritage
Needs to work on IE at least

TITLE: Client Meeting 2 - Evaluation System
DECISIONS: Allan does marking with rubrics - There's places online that he can do this and use them
Purposes of the rubric are for allan and others to mark
Peer assessment portion needs to be then manually done by Allan
Once a rubric has been defined X people can mark it and they're marking Y person
Allan needs to be able to define the criteria for the rubric
Define a marking rubric from a high level - Competencies and a mark to that
Have a total sum of the mark at the end and notes on what each number means
Assign a mark based on each criteria, then the system goes and adds it all up.
Users - Teacher / Assigned Student / Markee so that they can go and see their mark
The markers need to know who they're marking, but you won't know who marked you
More difficult rubrics with ranges of numbers as well with something like 0-6 for fail, 6-7, etc.
Ability to add comments section to the marking rubric
Most complex would be a check list rubric like the one we used in C40
Right now it's all done in either word or excel and it's difficult to compile and use
Like the Teammates system that we used, except it will assign actual grades / scores
Able to export the marks and dump it straight into Omnivox - export as like a CSV
Mobile friendly absolutely
Don't need to be able to create rubrics on mobile, just do the actual marking
Sometimes need to force comments, depending on the mark to justify a low mark or something
Ability to share rubrics with other teachers - or parts of a rubric
Highest level of organization would be by semester, then by course, then by assignment within that course
This needs to serve as a library of all rubrics created by all teachers up on this site
Keep all data forever
When creating a rubric, it will walk you through the process - Wizard
Send auto-emails with links to teachers to mark certain things
The biggest thing this solves is peer evaluation rubrics, however it needs to be able to handle all rubrics - Allan should be able to use this system to mark
No need to be able to print this - the point is to drop paper
Once a rubric has been submitted by a student, the teacher must be able to decide what the student is able to see each section of it - ie. you may want to hide nasty comments
Students can only see their mark once the teacher has approved the marks and comments of all the markers
Can send rubrics to other teachers, and then once they've marked it, the rubric is gone to them. It will be marked and sent back to original teacher
Can only ask students to mark specific rows or columns of a rubric
Allan should be able to log in and check the status of who all has done their marking
Should be able to set dates and times for when the rubrics are accessible for students to mark.
Allan should be notified when the time frame is up with status of who all did it.
Teacher should be able to assess the quality of the evaluation that each student has performed.
Comments need to be vetted, maybe marks should be vetted too. Marks should be invalidated if they don't at all reflect what they should be.
This can allow the teacher to eliminate the outliers in the graders.
Some sort of statistical tool that the teacher can use to data mine the rubrics
Teacher should be able to see digested marks of each student for specific category
No need for teachers to be able to see a students overall mark for a course they aren't teaching them - only the marks they've given them for a single assignment
This needs to be able to read all the courses and their students out of Clara
Once an evaluator has submitted a rubric, they should not be able to go back and change it once the time has been shut down.
Self evaluations should also be do-able
Make a sort of file system like thing for you to be able to dig through each semester / program / course / assignement and view the rubric for that
